dependencies.name: iconv
dependencies.description: Dummy package to provide interfaces available in libc.

dependencies.name: ncurses
dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: tar
dependencies.description:
GNU Tar provides the ability to create tar archives, as well as various
other kinds of manipulation.

dependencies.name: bzip2
dependencies.description:
bzip2 is a freely available, patent free high-quality data compressor.
It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available
techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being
around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at
decompression.

dependencies.name: xz
dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.

dependencies.name: libunistring
dependencies.description:
This library provides functions for manipulating Unicode strings and for
manipulating C strings according to the Unicode standard.

dependent_to.name: cryptsetup
dependent_to.description: Cryptsetup and LUKS - open-source disk encryption.

dependent_to.name: xfsdump
dependent_to.description: XFS Dump Tools.

dependent_to.name: ctpl
dependent_to.description:
CTPL is a template engine library written in C and distributed under the
terms of the GNU GPL.

dependent_to.name: oci-systemd-hook
dependent_to.description:
OCI systemd hook enables users to run systemd in docker and OCI
compatible runtimes such as runc without requiring --privileged flag.

dependent_to.name: flex
dependent_to.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependent_to.name: procps
dependent_to.description:
Command line and full screen utilities for browsing procfs, a "pseudo"
file system dynamically generated by the kernel to provide information
about the status of entries in its process table.

dependent_to.name: libnsl
dependent_to.description:
This library contains the public client interface for NIS(YP) and NIS+
in a IPv6 ready version.

dependent_to.name: gdk-pixbuf
dependent_to.description:
The Gdk Pixbuf is a toolkit for image loading and pixel buffer
manipulation. It is used by GTK+ 2 and GTK+ 3 to load and manipulate
images. In the past it was distributed as part of GTK+ 2 but it was
split off into a separate package in preparation for the change to GTK+
3.

dependent_to.name: numdiff
dependent_to.description:
Numdiff is a little program that can be used to compare putatively
similar files line by line and field by field, ignoring small numeric
differences or/and different numeric formats.

dependent_to.name: bcache
dependent_to.description:
Bcache is a patch for the Linux kernel to use SSDs to cache other block
devices.

dependent_to.name: sst-macro
dependent_to.description:
The Structural Simulation Toolkit Macroscale Element Library simulates
large-scale parallel computer architectures for the coarse-grained study
of distributed-memory applications. The simulator is driven from either
a trace file or skeleton application. SST/macro's modular architecture
can be extended with additional network models, trace file formats,
software services, and processor models.

dependent_to.name: gtkplus
dependent_to.description:
The GTK+ package contains libraries used for creating graphical user
interfaces for applications.

dependent_to.name: gmake
dependent_to.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependent_to.name: cctools
dependent_to.description:
The Cooperative Computing Tools (cctools) enable large scale distributed
computations to harness hundreds to thousands of machines from clusters,
clouds, and grids.

dependent_to.name: hunspell
dependent_to.description: The most popular spellchecking library (sez the author...).

dependent_to.name: neovim
dependent_to.description: Neovim: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

dependent_to.name: elfutils
dependent_to.description:
elfutils is a collection of various binary tools such as eu-objdump, eu-
readelf, and other utilities that allow you to inspect and manipulate
ELF files. Refer to Table 5.Tools Included in elfutils for Red Hat
Developer for a complete list of binary tools that are distributed with
the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of elfutils.

dependent_to.name: guile
dependent_to.description:
Guile is the GNU Ubiquitous Intelligent Language for Extensions, the
official extension language for the GNU operating system.

dependent_to.name: binutils
dependent_to.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others

dependent_to.name: mesa
dependent_to.description:
Mesa is an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification - a
system for rendering interactive 3D graphics.

dependent_to.name: libpsl
dependent_to.description: libpsl - C library to handle the Public Suffix List.

dependent_to.name: glib
dependent_to.description:
GLib provides the core application building blocks for libraries and
applications written in C. The GLib package contains a low-level
libraries useful for providing data structure handling for C,
portability wrappers and interfaces for such runtime functionality as an
event loop, threads, dynamic loading and an object system.

dependent_to.name: audacious
dependent_to.description: A lightweight and versatile audio player.

dependent_to.name: cracklib
dependent_to.description:
CrackLib tests passwords to determine whether they match certain
security-oriented characteristics, with the purpose of stopping users
from choosing passwords that are easy to guess.

dependent_to.name: wget
dependent_to.description:
GNU Wget is a free software package for retrieving files using HTTP,
HTTPS and FTP, the most widely-used Internet protocols. It is a non-
interactive commandline tool, so it may easily be called from scripts,
cron jobs, terminals without X-Windows support, etc.

dependent_to.name: git
dependent_to.description:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system
designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with
speed and efficiency.

dependent_to.name: open-iscsi
dependent_to.description:
The Open-iSCSI project is a high-performance, transport independent,
multi-platform implementation of RFC3720 iSCSI.

dependent_to.name: libmicrohttpd
dependent_to.description:
GNU libmicrohttpd is a small C library that is supposed to make it easy
to run an HTTP server as part of another application.

dependent_to.name: man-db
dependent_to.description:
man-db is an implementation of the standard Unix documentation system
accessed using the man command. It uses a Berkeley DB database in place
of the traditional flat-text whatis databases.

dependent_to.name: neuron
dependent_to.description:
NEURON is a simulation environment for single and networks of neurons.
NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual and networks
of neurons. NEURON models individual neurons via the use of sections
that are automatically subdivided into individual compartments, instead
of requiring the user to manually create compartments.

dependent_to.name: xfd
dependent_to.description:
xfd - display all the characters in a font using either the X11 core
protocol or libXft2.

dependent_to.name: libconfuse
dependent_to.description: Small configuration file parser library for C.

dependent_to.name: pulseaudio
dependent_to.description:
PulseAudio is a sound system for POSIX OSes, meaning that it is a proxy
for your sound applications. PulseAudio is a sound system for POSIX
OSes, meaning that it is a proxy for your sound applications. It allows
you to do advanced operations on your sound data as it passes between
your application and your hardware. Things like transferring the audio
to a different machine, changing the sample format or channel count and
mixing several sounds into one are easily achieved using a sound server.

dependent_to.name: xfsprogs
dependent_to.description: XFS User Tools.

dependent_to.name: libpeas
dependent_to.description:
libpeas is a gobject-based plugins engine, and is targeted at giving
every application the chance to assume its own extensibility.

dependent_to.name: rng-tools
dependent_to.description:
This is a random number generator daemon. It monitors a set of entropy
sources, and supplies entropy from them to the system kernel's
/dev/random machinery.

dependent_to.name: systemtap
dependent_to.description:
SystemTap provides free software (GPL) infrastructure to simplify the
gathering of information about the running Linux system. This assists
diagnosis of a performance or functional problem. SystemTap eliminates
the need for the developer to go through the tedious and disruptive
instrument, recompile, install, and reboot sequence that may be
otherwise required to collect data.

dependent_to.name: extrae
dependent_to.description:
Extrae is the package devoted to generate tracefiles which can be
analyzed later by Paraver. Extrae is a tool that uses different
interposition mechanisms to inject probes into the target application so
as to gather information regarding the application performance. The
Extrae instrumentation package can instrument the MPI programin model,
and the following parallel programming models either alone or in
conjunction with MPI : OpenMP, CUDA, OpenCL, pthread, OmpSs

dependent_to.name: qt
dependent_to.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependent_to.name: nfs-utils
dependent_to.description:
The NFS Utilities package contains the userspace server and client tools
necessary to use the kernel's NFS abilities. NFS is a protocol that
allows sharing file systems over the network.

dependent_to.name: gnutls
dependent_to.description:
GnuTLS is a secure communications library implementing the SSL, TLS and
DTLS protocols and technologies around them. It provides a simple C
language application programming interface (API) to access the secure
communications protocols as well as APIs to parse and write X.509, PKCS
#12, OpenPGP and other required structures. It is aimed to be portable
and efficient with focus on security and interoperability.

dependent_to.name: dia
dependent_to.description: Dia is a program for drawing structured diagrams.

dependent_to.name: fish
dependent_to.description:
fish is a smart and user-friendly command line shell for OS X, Linux,
and the rest of the family.

dependent_to.name: shared-mime-info
dependent_to.description: Database of common MIME types.

dependent_to.name: gawk
dependent_to.description:
If you are like many computer users, you would frequently like to make
changes in various text files wherever certain patterns appear, or
extract data from parts of certain lines while discarding the rest. To
write a program to do this in a language such as C or Pascal is a time-
consuming inconvenience that may take many lines of code. The job is
easy with awk, especially the GNU implementation: gawk. The awk utility
interprets a special-purpose programming language that makes it possible
to handle simple data-reformatting jobs with just a few lines of code.

dependent_to.name: mesa18
dependent_to.description:
Mesa is an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification - a
system for rendering interactive 3D graphics.

dependent_to.name: gtksourceview
dependent_to.description:
GtkSourceView is a GNOME library that extends GtkTextView, the standard
GTK+ widget for multiline text editing. GtkSourceView adds support for
syntax highlighting, undo/redo, file loading and saving, search and
replace, a completion system, printing, displaying line numbers, and
other features typical of a source code editor.

dependent_to.name: sst-elements
dependent_to.description:
SST Elements implements a range of components for performing
architecture simulation from node-level to system-level using the SST
discrete event core.

dependent_to.name: python
dependent_to.description: The Python programming language.

dependent_to.name: axel
dependent_to.description: Axel is a light command line download accelerator for Linux and Unix

dependent_to.name: pinfo
dependent_to.description: Pinfo is user-friendly, console-based viewer for Info documents.

dependent_to.name: watch
dependent_to.description: Executes a program periodically, showing output fullscreen.

dependent_to.name: gsettings-desktop-schemas
dependent_to.description:
gsettings-desktop-schemas contains a collection of GSettings schemas for
settings shared by various components of a desktop.

dependent_to.name: acl
dependent_to.description: Commands for Manipulating POSIX Access Control Lists.

dependent_to.name: rpcsvc-proto
dependent_to.description: rpcsvc protocol definitions from glibc.

dependent_to.name: glib-networking
dependent_to.description: Network-related giomodules for glib.

dependent_to.name: p11-kit
dependent_to.description:
p11-kit aims to solve problems with coordinating the use of PKCS #11 by
different components or libraries living in the same process, by
providing a way to load and enumerate PKCS #11 modules, as well as a
standard configuration setup for installing PKCS #11 modules in such a
way that they're discoverable.

dependent_to.name: atk
dependent_to.description:
ATK provides the set of accessibility interfaces that are implemented by
other toolkits and applications. Using the ATK interfaces, accessibility
tools have full access to view and control running applications.

dependent_to.name: libxpm
dependent_to.description: libXpm - X Pixmap (XPM) image file format library.

dependent_to.name: libgd
dependent_to.description:
GD is an open source code library for the dynamic creation of images by
programmers. GD is written in C, and "wrappers" are available for Perl,
PHP and other languages. GD creates PNG, JPEG, GIF, WebP, XPM, BMP
images, among other formats. GD is commonly used to generate charts,
graphics, thumbnails, and most anything else, on the fly. While not
restricted to use on the web, the most common applications of GD involve
website development.

dependent_to.name: dos2unix
dependent_to.description: DOS/Mac to Unix and vice versa text file format converter.

dependent_to.name: sst-core
dependent_to.description:
The Structural Simulation Toolkit (SST) core provides a parallel
discrete event simulation (PDES) framework for performing architecture
simulations of existing and proposed HPC systems

dependent_to.name: cln
dependent_to.description:
CLN is a library for efficient computations with all kinds of numbers in
arbitrary precision. It features number classes for unlimited length
integers, rationals, arbitrary precision floating point numbers and much
more.

dependent_to.name: iso-codes
dependent_to.description: ISO-codes provides lists of various ISO standards

dependent_to.name: at-spi2-core
dependent_to.description:
The At-Spi2 Core package provides a Service Provider Interface for the
Assistive Technologies available on the GNOME platform and a library
against which applications can be linked.

dependent_to.name: rpm
dependent_to.description:
The RPM package manager https://github.com/rpm-software-
management/rpm/blob/master/INSTALL Note that debugedit is an additional
tool that *should* compile with adding libdw and elfutils, but the
library (as of 4.16.1.2) is being removed from rpm and will be put
somewhere else.
